alert.note: Alert for Beartooth Foothills; Livingston Area (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 02 at 2:16AM MST until January 03 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds gusting up to 75 mph expected. Local blizzard conditions in blowing snow. * WHERE...Livingston Area and Beartooth Foothills. * WHEN...Through 6 PM MST Monday. Strongest wind gusts expected through mid day today. * IMPACTS...Dangerous crosswinds will make travel difficult or impossible at times for high profile vehicles and those towing trailers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow will create widespread poor visibility and significant drifting snow. Localized blizzard conditions are possible, which along with significant drifting snow, may make travel impossible. This includes portions of I-90. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... People should be prepared for very difficult to impossible travel and dangerous winter conditions. Don`t travel during this time if you don`t have to. Travelers should have winter survival kits with them and notify someone of your travel plans and arrival time. Getting stranded in this high wind winter situation could be life threatening. Additional graphics for this hazard can be found at http://www.weather.gov/billings
